page.title: 15TREES IN THE HIGH WEALD
page.content: Sussex is well covered by trees of all types,{oak, beech, silver birch, {alder, spruce, chestnut, hazel, ash and{hornbeam.}Oaks reach a great age and because of this are often seen with dead branches still attached. They provide a bronze tinted canopy in autumn which is admired by all who love the countryside. Sometimes beech trees are found growing amongst the sandstone formations in the area, their roots clinging to the rocks with little or no earth attached. Fine{collections of trees}are to be found on private estates in the area, many horticulturalists making long journeys to visit them.
